title: Disabled Veteran Property Tax Deduction ($24,960 assessed value deduction)
summary: Deduction from assessed value for a veteran with a total disability (reduces property tax burden).

requirements.notes: Indiana law allows an eligible individual to deduct $24,960 from assessed value under specified criteria.

eligibilityNotes: Eligibility details and documentation are governed by Indiana statute and administered locally (typically through the county).

title: Child of Deceased or Disabled Veteran – Tuition & Fee Coverage
summary: Covers up to 100% of tuition and regularly assessed fees at Indiana public colleges (and up to a cap at eligible private non-profit schools).

requirements.notes: Program details include credit-hour limits and different rules depending on institution type.

eligibilityNotes: Indiana Commission for Higher Education program; coverage includes public institutions and capped assistance at eligible private non-profit schools.

title: Child of Purple Heart Recipient or Wounded Veteran – Tuition & Fee Coverage
summary: Tuition and regularly assessed fee coverage for eligible children at Indiana public colleges and capped support at certain private non-profit schools.

requirements.notes: Program rules include maximum credit hours and eligible institution rules.

eligibilityNotes: Administered as part of Indiana’s state financial aid programs; see program page for details and application path.

title: Indiana Veterans’ Home (IVH) – Long-Term Care
summary: State veterans home providing nursing care and related services for eligible veterans (and in some cases spouses).

requirements.notes: Residency requirements, background check, medical need, and bed availability may apply.

eligibilityNotes: Applicants generally must meet IVH eligibility requirements and submit an admissions packet; see IVH admissions pages for details.

title: Indiana Veterans Memorial Cemetery (Madison) – Burial Benefits
summary: State veterans cemetery program with eligibility information and pre-need determination options.

requirements.notes: Eligibility and required documentation apply; pre-need eligibility determination available.

eligibilityNotes: Operated by Indiana DVA; see the cemetery page for applications and eligibility requirements.

title: Military CDL Skills Examination Waiver (Indiana BMV)
summary: Eligible service members/veterans may qualify for a waiver of the CDL skills test under the military skills waiver program.

requirements.notes: CDL eligibility requirements apply; waiver details are provided on the Indiana BMV CDL pages.

eligibilityNotes: Use Indiana BMV guidance for the Military CDL Skills Examination Waiver Program requirements and process.

title: National Guard Supplemental Grant (NGSG)
summary: Guarantees up to 100% tuition and regularly assessed fees for Indiana National Guard members attending Indiana public institutions for their first associate, bachelor, or master degree.

requirements.notes: Must be IN Guard member BEFORE applying. Must be IN resident, high school graduate or GED. Part-time (3-11 hours) or full-time (12-15 hours) enrollment. Unit certification required each semester.

eligibilityNotes: IN state grant program for active IN Army/Air National Guard members in good standing. Covers up to 100% tuition and regularly assessed fees at IN public institutions for first associate, bachelor, or master degree. Must file FAFSA by March 10 (error-free by May 15) annually. Must maintain Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP) per institution. Must be IN Guard member before applying - cannot join retroactively. Unit commander certification required each semester. Annual application resets every June. Applications due no later than 5 days before classes start. Apply through ScholarTrack.IN.gov. Contact unit education office or ng.in.arng.list.j1arp-eds@army.mil for questions.
